definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: King Zhou increasingly dissolute without Road, outspoken minister was demoted to remonstrate both killed.
sentences.chinese: 紂王日益荒淫無道，大臣剛直勸諫者皆被殺被貶。

sentences.english: At youth time, his rigidity was really extremely arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 在青年時候，他的剛直還近於狂妄。

sentences.english: If children live with fairness, they learn justice. -----by Dorothy Law Nolte.
sentences.chinese: 在公平中長大的孩子，懂得剛直正義。

sentences.english: The most outstanding characteristics of Fu Lei is his rigidity.
sentences.chinese: 傅雷的性格，最突出的是他的剛直。

sentences.english: And just like their food, people of Sichuan are straight and spicy too.
sentences.chinese: 就像他們的食物一樣，四川人剛直而潑辣。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
brush stroke to the side (calligraphy)/fig. side stroke/lateral thinking
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
to have a sense of shame
of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
